required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multiple Ascending Dose Trial Assessing Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of ZP7570
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multiple Ascending Dose Trial Assessing Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Multiple Subcutaneous Doses of ZP7570 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multiple ascending dose trial in healthy subjects, randomised to ZP7570 or placebo within each cohort

detailed_description.textblock: Forty subjects are planned to be studied in four cohorts in this multiple ascending dose trial. Ten subjects will be allocated to four dose levels. Intermediate dose levels may be applied. A sentinel dosing approach (sequential dosing) will be applied. The entire observation period comprises 51 days starting with a 96 hours in-house stay after the first dose injection, where discharge is planned for Day 5, followed by one outpatient visit. For the second and the third injection dose a 36 hours in-house stay is planned. After the fourth dose injection there is also a 96 hour in-house stay where discharge is planned for Day 26, followed by five outpatient visits and an End of Trial Visit on Day 51. A blinded evaluation of each cohort will be performed by a Trial Safety Group to determine whether the trial will progress to the next planned dose level based on the stopping rules specified in the protocol.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, single ascending dose trial in healthy subjects, randomized to ZP7570 or placebo

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability - Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events as assessed by type and severity
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing) ]
primary_outcome.description: The incidence, type and severity of treatment emergent adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Area under the plasma concentration-time curve - through
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: AUCτ, Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from zero to through concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Area under the plasma concentration-time curve - infinity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: AUCinf, Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from zero to infinity concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Area under the plasma concentration-time curve - last
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: AUClast, Area under the plasma concentration-time curve-from zero to last concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Maximum plasma concentration - Cmax
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax, Measured maximum plasma drug concentration after dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Time to maximum plasma concentration - Tmax
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax, Sampling time until reaching Cmax after dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Elimination rate constant - λz
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: λz, Elimination rate constant

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Half-life - t½
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: t½, Half-life of ZP7570

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Volume of distribution - Vz/f
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Vz/f, Apparent volume of distribution of ZP7570 during terminal phase

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Body clearance - CL/f
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: CL/f, Apparent total body clearance

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics - Mean residence time - MRT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: MRT, Mean residence time

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics - Acetaminophen concentration-time curves
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 240 minutes at baseline, 24 hours after a single dose and 24 hours after the the forth dose
secondary_outcome.description: Acetaminophen concentration-time curves following ingestion of mixed meal test and acetaminophen

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-ZP7570 antibodies - Incidence and titres
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall anti-ZP7570 antibody incidence and titers. Incidence of anti-ZP7570 antibodies cross-reacting with endogenous GLP-1 or GLP-2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety Lab - Haematological values vs. reference ranges and baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormal values or changes in haematology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety Lab - Clinical chemistry values vs. reference ranges and baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormal values or changes in chemical chemistry

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety Lab - Urinalysis values vs. reference ranges and baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Abnormal values or changes in urinalysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety - Vital signs: blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in diastolic and systolic blood pressure (in mmHg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety - Vital signs: pulse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in pulse (beats per minute)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety - Physical Examination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in physical examination of the body. Outcome will be measured as 'normal' or 'abnormal', if abnormal as 'not clinically significant' or 'clinically significant'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety - ECG
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes or abnormalities in ECG parameters (in ms): Heart rate, PR, QRS, QT, QTcF

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety - Injection site reactions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time 0 to 51 days after first dosing (29 days after fourth dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of injection site reactions

intervention.description: Each subject will be randomly allocated to multiple doses of ZP7570 at one of four dose levels in each cohort.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed and dated informed consent obtained before any trial-related activities. Trial-related activities are any procedures that would not have been done during normal management of the subject.
- Healthy male or female subject (only women not of childbearing potential) aged between 18 and 55 years, both inclusive.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18.5 and 28.0 kg/m2, both inclusive
- A body weight of at least 60 kg.
- Heart rate after 5 minutes rest in supine position inside the range of 50-90 beats/min at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any history of a disorder which in the investigator's opinion might jeopardize subjects safety, evaluation of results or compliance with the protocol.
- History of gallbladder disease or cholecystectomy.
- History of pancreatitis
- History of major depressive disorder or a Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) > 9 completed at screening, or a history of other severe psychiatric disorders (e.g. schizophrenia or bipolar disorder).
- Any suicidal ideation of type 4 or 5 on the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) within 6 months prior to screening.
- Family history of multiple endocrinological neoplasia type 2 (MEN2) or medullary thyroid carcinoma (MTC).
- Clinically significant abnormal standard 12-lead ECG after 5 min resting in supine position at screening, including a QTcF > 450 ms (males) or QTcF > 470 ms (females), PR ≥ 220 ms and QRS ≥ 110 ms.
- History of severe hypersensitivity to medicines or foods or history of severe medicinal/food induced anaphylactic reaction .
- Any clinically significant abnormal hematology, biochemistry, or urinalysis screening tests, as judged by the investigator.
- TSH values outside of normal reference ranges of safety laboratory
- Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) < 90 ml/min/1.73 m2, as defined by - Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI).
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity to IMP(s) or related products.
- Systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg or >139 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure < 50 mmHg or > 89 mmHg (one repeat test will be acceptable in case of suspected white-coat hypertension).
- Symptoms of arterial hypotension
- Women of childbearing potential
- Men with non-pregnant partner(s) of childbearing potential not willing to use male contraception (condom) in addition to a highly effective contraceptive method until 28 days after dosing
- Men with pregnant partner not willing to use male contraception (condom) until 28 days after dosing, in order to avoid exposure of the embryo/fetus to seminal fluid.
